attributes.action: Debate the unfair retraction of Uber's licence in London.
attributes.background: London: spiralling costs and unaffordable rents, is not 'open for business'. Through the removal of consumer choice, by trying to ban Uber, Londoners face no alternative to the extortionate fees charged by black cabs. This is not a decision made with the best interests of Londoners at its heart.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the issue you raise is not the responsibility of the Government or Parliament. This is the responsibility of the London Assembly.

The London Assembly has its own petitions process. You can find out more about how to petition the London Assembly here:

https://www.london.gov.uk/about-us/london-assembly/petitions
